import json
from datetime import datetime

# Parameters passed from the pipeline
notebook_input = json.loads(input)
table_name = notebook_input["table_name"]
last_ingest_date = notebook_input["last_ingest_date"]

print(f"Updating ingestion timestamp for: {table_name} to {last_ingest_date}")

# Read current watermark table from the Lake Database
watermark_table = spark.read.table("odw_standardised_db.last_ingest_dates")

from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, to_timestamp
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, TimestampType
from datetime import datetime, timezone

# Create new row with current UTC timestamp
new_row = spark.createDataFrame(
    [(table_name, datetime.now(timezone.utc))],
    schema=StructType([
        StructField("TableName", StringType(), False),
        StructField("LastIngestDate", TimestampType(), False)
    ])
)

# Remove existing record (if any) for the same table
filtered = watermark_table.filter(watermark_table.TableName != table_name)

# Combine new + filtered data
final_df = filtered.unionByName(new_row)

# Write the updated table back
final_df.write.format("delta").mode("overwrite").saveAsTable("odw_standardised_db.last_ingest_dates")
